items.sentence: The last time I saw Tom, he was still dating Mary.
I want to live in a place where locks don't exist.
My mother has straight hair and I have curly hair.
I'm going to change into more comfortable clothes.
I'm left-handed, and so I write with my left hand.
I'm looking forward to getting to know you better.
You aren't the only one here from Boston, are you?
You aren't really planning on doing that, are you?
Tom won't listen to anyone who disagrees with him.
Let's not do anything without discussing it first.
If I were you, I'd do the same thing Tom is doing.
I don't know whether that's what Tom wants or not.
Tom said that he thought that John was Mary's son.
I don't think that Tom knows Mary is a vegetarian.
I don't think that Tom knows why Mary left Boston.
I don't think Tom knows that Mary is a vegetarian.
I don't think that Tom knows that Mary is unhappy.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was worried.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was excited.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was nervous.
